measured_by: Positive Activation Rating Scale (PARS – PA subscale)
justification: “The 10-point rating scale of PARS positive activation (PA) assessed the relative absence to the strong presence of positively valenced agentic emotion.”

measured_by: Negative Activation Rating Scale (NARS – NA subscale)
justification: “The separate 10-point rating scale of NARS negative activation (NA) assessed the relative absence to the strong presence of negatively valenced agentic emotion.”
construct: negatively valenced agentic emotion / agentic anger

measured_by: Social Potency scale of the Multidimensional Personality Questionnaire-Brief Form (MPQ-BF)
justification: “The primary trait of interest was social potency (SP), a measure of trait agency,” assessed with “the Multidimensional Personality Questionnaire Brief Form (MPQ-BF).”
“Non-agentic traits were (1) stress reaction (SR), a measure of trait anxiety…,” all assessed with the MPQ-BF.
The authors list “(2) control (CON), a measure of trait behavioral planfulness as opposed to spontaneity,” among MPQ-BF traits.
They note “(3) social closeness (SC), a measure of trait affiliation rather than agency,” measured via the MPQ-BF.
The paper identifies “(4) harm avoidance (HA), a measure of trait fear rather than anxiety,” within the MPQ-BF.
It states “(5) absorption (ABS), a measure of mental-emotional flexibility and capacity for immersive emotion,” assessed by the MPQ-BF.
The authors include “(6) aggression (AG), a measure of trait hostility and intent to harm,” as an MPQ-BF subscale.
“Subjective elation was rated on a 100 mm visual analogue scale (VAS)… providing a subjective measure of positive incentive tone.”
“State anxiety was evaluated by … a 100 mm VAS scale … with anxiety rated from ‘not at all’ to ‘extremely.’”

measured_by: Profile of Mood States (POMS) – Arousal scale
justification: “The Profile of Mood States (POMS) Arousal scale provided a measure of subjective arousal.”

measured_by: Profile of Mood States (POMS) – Anxiety scale
justification: “State anxiety was evaluated by the POMS anxiety scale.”
“Physiological arousal was evaluated by systolic blood pressure….”
“Physiological arousal was evaluated by … diastolic blood pressure….”
“Physiological arousal was evaluated by … heart rate.”
